noInnerDeclarations.description:
Description

Disallowfunctionandvardeclarations that are accessible outside their block.
Avaris accessible in the whole body of the nearest root (function, module, script, static block).
To avoid confusion, they should be declared to the nearest root.
Prior to ES2015,functiondeclarations were only allowed in the nearest root,
though parsers sometimes erroneously accept them elsewhere.
In ES2015, inside anES module, afunctiondeclaration is always block-scoped.
Note thatconstandletdeclarations are block-scoped,
and therefore they are not affected by this rule.
Moreover,functiondeclarations in nested blocks are allowed insideES modules.
noInnerDeclarations.option: This rule has no specific options.
